Description: Fragment of rim of black-figured pottery krater; on top, lion or panther to left with red details; outside of rim glazed, with part of graffito inscription.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 741, no. 1003)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 107, pl. XXXIV, no. 318.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.532)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5911 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
